title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 255.369 - Service lines: connections to cast iron or ductile iron mains
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 255.369 - Service lines: connections to cast iron or ductile iron mains

State Regulations
(a) Each service line connected to a cast
iron or ductile iron main must be connected by a mechanical clamp, by drilling
and tapping the main, or by another method meeting the requirements of section
255.273
of this Part. (b) If a threaded tap is being inserted, the
requirements of section
255.151
(b)-(c)
of
this Part must also be met. (c) Service line connections shall not be brazed directly to cast iron or ductile
iron mains. (d) Service lines must
meet the electrical isolation requirements of section
255.467
(b) of
this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
ยง
255.369

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
